source_sentence: 我聞如是：一時，佛遊舍衛國，在勝林給孤獨園，與大比丘眾俱而受夏坐。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha traveled to the country of Śrāvastī and spent the summer retreat at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove, where he was accompanied by a large assembly of monks.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘：「我一坐食，一坐食已，無為無求，無有病痛，身體輕便，氣力康強，安隱快樂。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "I eat during one sitting, and after I eat during that sitting, I have nothing to do, nothing to seek, no illness, a light body, strong vitality, and peace and happiness.

source_sentence: 汝等亦當學一坐食，一坐食已，無為無求，無有病痛，身體輕便，氣力康強，安隱快樂。」
translation: You too should follow the example of the one-sitting monk who, after eating from one seat, has nothing to do and nothing to seek, has no illness or pain, has a light body, has strong vitality, and is peaceful and happy."

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者跋陀和利亦在眾中。
translation: At the time, Venerable Bhadrapāla was also among the crowd.

source_sentence: 於是，尊者跋陀和利即從坐起，偏袒著衣，叉手向佛，白曰：「世尊！
translation: Venerable Bhadrapāla then rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, saluted the Buddha with his palms together, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我不堪任於一坐食。
translation: "I can't afford to eat while sitting in one place.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若我一坐食者，同不了事，懊惱心悔。
translation: "If I were to sit here and eat, I wouldn't be able to do the same thing, and I'd regret it.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是故我不堪任一坐食也。」
translation: That's why I can't afford to sit down and eat at any one time."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「跋陀和利！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 若我受請，汝亦隨我，聽汝請食，持去一坐食。
translation: If I accept your invitation, you also follow me, listen to your invitation for food, and take away a seat for food.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 若如是者，快得生活。」
translation: If this is the case, you'll quickly attain livelihood."

source_sentence: 尊者跋陀和利又復白曰：「世尊！
translation: Venerable Bhaddāli again said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是，我亦不堪於一坐食。
translation: "Thus, I wouldn't be able to eat while sitting in one place.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若我一坐食者，同不了事，懊惱心悔。
translation: "If I were to sit here and eat, I wouldn't be able to do the same thing, and I'd regret it.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是故我不堪任一坐食也。」
translation: I therefore can't afford to eat while sitting down."

source_sentence: 世尊復至再三告諸比丘：「我一坐食，一坐食已，無為無求，無有病痛，身體輕便，氣力康強，安隱快樂。
translation: The Bhagavān again and again addressed the monks, "I eat once sitting down, and after I eat once sitting down, I have nothing to do, nothing to seek, no illness or pain, my body is relaxed, my energy is strong, and I'm peaceful and happy.

source_sentence: 汝等亦當學一坐食，一坐食已，無為無求，無有病痛，身體輕便，氣力康強，安隱快樂。」
translation: You too will learn to eat once sitting down, and after eating once sitting down, you'll have nothing to do, nothing to seek, no illness or pain, a light body, strong vitality, and peace and happiness."

translation: Venerable Bhadrapāla also rose from his seat three times, adjusted his robes, saluted the Buddha with his palms together, and said, "Bhagavān!

translation: I therefore can't afford to sit down and eat at any one time."

translation: Again, the Bhagavān repeatedly told him, "Bhaddāli!

translation: If I accept your invitation, you also follow me, listen to your invitation for food, and take away a seat for food.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！

translation: Venerable Bhaddāli came back and said repeatedly, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是我亦不堪於一坐食。
translation: "Thus, I wouldn't be able to eat from a single seat.

source_sentence: 所以者何？

translation: "If I were to sit here and eat, I wouldn't be able to do the same thing, and I'd regret it.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是故我不堪任一坐食也。」
translation: Therefore, I'm not fit to eat while sitting down."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊為比丘眾施設一坐食戒，諸比丘眾皆奉學戒及世尊境界諸微妙法，唯尊者跋陀和利說不堪任，從坐起去。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān established the precept of one sitting meal for a group of monks, and they all consecrated themselves to studying the precepts and the subtle Dharma of the Bhagavān's realm, except for Venerable Bhaddāli, who said he couldn't handle it and got up from his seat.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 不學具戒及世尊境界諸微妙法故。
translation: That's because he didn't train in the full set of precepts or the subtleties of the Bhagavān's realm.

source_sentence: 於是，尊者跋陀和利遂藏一夏，不見世尊。
translation: Venerable Bhadrapāla then hid away for a summer and didn't see the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以不學具戒及世尊境界諸微妙法故。
translation: That's because they hadn't studied the full set of precepts or the subtleties of the Bhagavān's realm.

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘為佛作衣，世尊於舍衛國受夏坐訖，過三月已，補治衣竟，攝衣持鉢，當遊人間。
translation: When the monks had made robes for the Buddha, the Bhagavān finished his summer retreat in Śrāvastī and, after three months had passed, finished mending his robes, gathered his robe and bowl, and was about to wander among the people.

source_sentence: 尊者跋陀和利聞諸比丘為佛作衣，世尊於舍衛國受夏坐訖，過三月已，補治衣竟，攝衣持鉢，當遊人間。
translation: Venerable Bhaddāli heard that the monks had made robes for the Buddha, and after the Bhagavān finished his summer retreat in Śrāvastī, he had finished mending his robes, gathered his robe and bowl, and was about to wander among the people.

source_sentence: 尊者跋陀和利聞已，往詣諸比丘所，諸比丘遙見尊者跋陀和利來，便作是語：「賢者跋陀和利！
translation: After Venerable Bhadrapāla heard that, he went to the monks, and when they saw Venerable Bhadrapāla coming from a distance, the monks said, "Good man, Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 汝當知此為佛作衣，世尊於舍衛國受夏坐訖，過三月已，補治衣竟，攝衣持鉢，當遊人間。
translation: You should know that this is the robe made for the Buddha when the Bhagavān finished his summer retreat in Śrāvastī and finished mending his robes after three months had passed, then he gathered his robe and bowl and traveled among people.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利，汝當彼處善自守護，莫令後時致多煩勞。」
translation: Bhadrapāla, guard that place well, so that you don't cause much trouble later."

source_sentence: 尊者跋陀和利聞此語已，即詣佛所，稽首佛足，白曰：「世尊！
translation: After hearing these words, Venerable Bhadrapāla went to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我實有過，我實有過，如愚如癡，如不了，如不善。
translation: "I really have faults, and I really have faults like being stupid and deluded, like not understanding, and like being unskillful.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 世尊為比丘眾施設一坐食戒，諸比丘眾皆奉學戒及世尊境界諸微妙法，唯我說不堪任，從坐起去。
translation: The Bhagavān established a precept for monks to sit down and eat, and while they all consecrated themselves to studying the precepts and the subtle Dharma of the Bhagavān's realm, I was the only one who said it wasn't up to them and got up from my seat.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以不學具戒及世尊境界諸微妙法故。」
translation: It's because they don't train in the full set of precepts and the subtle dharmas of the Bhagavān's realm."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「跋陀和利！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 汝於爾時不知眾多比丘、比丘尼於舍衛國而受夏坐，彼知我、見我，有比丘名跋陀和利，世尊弟子，不學具戒及世尊境界諸微妙法。
translation: At the time, you didn't know that many monks and nuns in Śrāvastī had spent the summer retreat there, knowing and seeing me, and there was a monk named Bhaddāli, a disciple of the Bhagavān who didn't train in the full set of precepts or the subtleties of the Bhagavān's realm.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 汝於爾時不知如此耶？
translation: Did you not know this at the time?

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 汝於爾時不知眾多優婆塞、優婆夷居舍衛國，彼知我、見我，有比丘名跋陀和利，世尊弟子，不學具戒及世尊境界諸微妙法。
translation: At the time, you didn't know that many laymen and upāsikā were living in Śrāvastī, and that they knew and saw me, a monk named Bhaddāli, a disciple of the Bhagavān who didn't train in the full set of precepts or the subtleties of the Bhagavān's realm.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 汝於爾時不知如此耶？
translation: Did you not know this at the time?

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 汝於爾時不知眾多異學沙門、梵志於舍衛國而受夏坐，彼知我、見我，有比丘名跋陀和利，沙門瞿曇弟子，名德，不學具戒及世尊境界諸微妙法。
translation: At the time, you didn't know that many renegade ascetics and priests in Śrāvastī had taken the summer retreat, and that they knew and saw me, a monk named Bhadrapāla, an ascetic Gautama disciple named Virtue who hadn't studied the full set of precepts or the subtleties of the Bhagavān's realm.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 汝於爾時不知如此耶？
translation: Did you not know this at the time?

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 若有比丘俱解脫者，我語彼曰：『汝來入泥。』
translation: If there's a monk who's equally liberated, I say to him, 'Come and enter the mud!'

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 我教彼比丘，彼比丘寧當可住而移避耶？」
translation: Would that monk prefer to stay and move away while I teach him?"

source_sentence: 尊者跋陀和利答曰：「不也。」
translation: Venerable Bhadrapāla answered, "No."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「跋陀和利！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 若有比丘，設非俱解脫有慧解脫，設非慧解脫有身證者，設非身證有見到者，設非見到有信解脫，設非信解脫有法行者，設非法行有信行者，我語彼曰：『汝來入泥。』
translation: If there's a monk who has liberation by wisdom that's not liberation by mass, who has physical realization that's not liberation by wisdom, who has insight that's not physical realization, who has liberation by faith that's not insight, who has the practice of the Dharma that's not liberation by faith, or who has the practice of faith that's not the practice of the Dharma, I say to him, 'Come and enter the mud.'

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 我教彼比丘，彼比丘寧當可住而移避耶？」
translation: Would that monk prefer to stay and move away while I teach him?"

source_sentence: 尊者跋陀和利答曰：「不也。」
translation: Venerable Bhadrapāla answered, "No."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「跋陀和利！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 汝於爾時得信行、法行、信解脫、見到、身證、慧解脫、俱解脫耶？」
translation: At that point, have you attained the practice of faith, the practice of the Dharma, the liberation of faith, the attainment of views, the realization of the body, the liberation of wisdom, and the liberation of both?"

source_sentence: 尊者跋陀和利答曰：「不也。」
translation: Venerable Bhadrapāla answered, "No."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「跋陀和利！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 汝於爾時非如空屋耶？」
translation: Were you not like an empty house at that point?"

source_sentence: 於是，尊者跋陀和利為世尊面呵責已，內懷憂慼，低頭默然，失辯無言，如有所伺。
translation: After being personally rebuked by the Bhagavān, Venerable Bhadrapāla was dejected at heart, hung his head in silence, lost his words, and looked around as if he had something to say.

source_sentence: 於是，世尊面呵責尊者跋陀和利已，復欲令歡喜，而告之曰：「跋陀和利！
translation: After the Bhagavān had personally rebuked Venerable Bhadrapāla, he wanted to make them happy and told them, "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 汝當爾時，於我無信法靖，無愛法靖，無靖法靖。
translation: At the time, you had no faith in me and no love for me, and you had no peace in the Dharma.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我為比丘眾施設一坐食戒，諸比丘眾皆奉學戒及世尊境界諸微妙法，唯汝說不堪任，從坐起去。
translation: "I have established a precept for monks to sit and eat, and while all of them have accepted the precepts and the subtle ways of the Bhagavān's realm, you're the only one who said it wasn't up to you to get up from your seat and leave.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以不學具戒及世尊境界諸微妙法故。」
translation: It's because they don't train in the full set of precepts and the subtleties of the Bhagavān's realm."

source_sentence: 尊者跋陀和利白曰：「實爾。
translation: Venerable Bhadrapāla said, "That's true.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 世尊為比丘眾施設一坐食戒，諸比丘眾皆奉學戒及世尊境界諸微妙法，唯我說不堪任，從坐起去。
translation: The Bhagavān established a precept for monks to sit down and eat, and while they all consecrated themselves to studying the precepts and the subtle Dharma of the Bhagavān's realm, I was the only one who said it wasn't up to them and got up from my seat.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以不學具戒及世尊境界諸微妙法故。
translation: It's because I didn't train in the full set of precepts or the subtle dharmas of the Bhagavān's realm.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊受我過失，我見過已，當自悔過，從今護之，不復更作。」
translation: Please let the Bhagavān accept my mistake. After I see it, I'll repent of it myself and guard it from now on, so I won't do it again."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「跋陀和利！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 如是，汝實如愚如癡，如不了、如不善。
translation: "Thus, you really are as foolish and deluded as you are unaware and unskillful.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我為比丘眾施設一坐食戒，諸比丘眾皆奉學戒及世尊境界諸微妙法，唯汝說不堪任，從坐起去。
translation: "I have established a precept for monks to sit and eat, and while all of them have accepted the precepts and the subtle ways of the Bhagavān's realm, you're the only one who said it wasn't up to you to get up from your seat and leave.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以汝不學具戒及世尊境界諸微妙法故。
translation: It's because you haven't studied the full set of precepts or the subtleties of the Bhagavān's realm.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 若汝有過，見已自悔，從今護之，不更作者。
translation: If you have transgressed, repent for yourself after seeing it, and guard it from now on so that you won't do it again.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 如是則於聖法、律中益而不損。
translation: Thus, you will gain and not lose from the noble principles and rules.

source_sentence: 若汝有過，見已自悔，從今護之，不更作者，跋陀和利！
translation: If you have transgressed, repent for yourself after seeing it, and guard it from now on so that you won't do it again, Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 若有比丘不學具戒者，彼住無事處山林樹下，或居高巖寂無音聲，遠離，無惡，無有人民，隨順燕坐，彼住遠離處，修行精勤，得增上心，現法樂居，彼住遠離處，修行精勤，安隱快樂，以誣謗世尊戒，及誣謗天諸智梵行者，亦誣謗自戒。
translation: If a monk who doesn't train in the full set of precepts lives under a tree in an unremitting mountain forest or on a high cliff where there's silence and no sound, seclusion, no evil, and no people, and he sits in a peaceful and comfortable environment, then he cultivates diligence in his practice while living in a secluded place, attains a superior attitude, and lives happily in the present life; he cultivates diligence in his practice while living in a secluded place, is comfortable and happy, and he misrepresents the precepts of the Bhagavān, misrepresents the wisdom and religious practices of the gods, and misrepresents his own precepts.

source_sentence: 彼誣謗世尊戒，及誣謗天諸智梵行者，亦誣謗自戒已，便不生歡悅，不生歡悅已，便不生喜，不生喜已，便不止身，不止身已，便不覺樂，不覺樂已，便心不定。
translation: After misrepresenting the Bhagavān's precepts, misrepresenting the wise religious practitioners of the gods, and misrepresenting their own precepts, they don't become happy; after not becoming happy, they don't become joyous; after not becoming joyous, they don't stop at body; after not stopping at body, they don't feel happy; after not feeling happy, their mind isn't settled.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 賢聖弟子心不定已，便不見如實、知如真。
translation: After a noble disciple's mind is unsettled, he doesn't see things as they really are and knows them as they really are.

source_sentence: 「跋陀和利！
translation: "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 若有比丘學具戒者，彼住無事處山林樹下，或居高巖寂無音聲，遠離，無惡，無有人民，隨順燕坐。
translation: "If a monk trains in the full set of precepts and lives under a tree in a mountain forest without an office or on a high cliff that's silent and without sound, isolated, without evil, and without people, he follows the swansong.

source_sentence: 彼住遠離處，修行精勤，得增上心，現法樂居。
translation: He lives in a secluded place, cultivates diligence, attains a superior mind, and lives happily in the present life.

source_sentence: 彼住遠離處，修行精勤，安隱快樂已，不誣謗世尊戒，不誣謗天、諸智梵行者，亦不誣謗自戒。
translation: After he lives in a secluded place, cultivates diligence, and is comfortable and happy, he doesn't misrepresent the Bhagavān's precepts, doesn't misrepresent the gods or wise religious practitioners, and doesn't misrepresent his own precepts.

source_sentence: 彼不誣謗世尊戒，不誣謗天、諸智梵行者，亦不誣謗自戒已，便生歡悅，生歡悅已，便生喜，生喜已，便止身，止身已，便覺樂，覺樂已，便心定。
translation: After he doesn't misrepresent the Bhagavān's precepts, doesn't misrepresent gods or wise religious practitioners, and doesn't misrepresent his own precepts, then he becomes happy, and after he becomes happy, then he becomes joyous, and after he becomes joyous, then he stops himself, and after he stops himself, then he feels happy, and after he feels happy, then his mind is concentrated.

source_sentence: 「跋陀和利！
translation: "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 賢聖弟子心定已，便見如實、知如真，見如實、知如真已，便離欲、離惡不善之法，有覺、有觀，離生喜、樂，得初禪成就遊。
translation: After the noble disciple's mind is concentrated, he then sees what really is and knows what's true, and after seeing what really is and knowing what's true, he then parts with desire, parts with bad and unskillful things, has perception and contemplation, parts with joy and happiness that arise, and attains accomplishment of the first dhyāna.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 是謂彼於爾時得第一增上心，即於現法得安樂居，易不難得，樂住無怖，安隱快樂，令昇涅槃。
translation: This is called the first intensified state of mind they attain at that point, which is to abide comfortably in the present life, which is easy and not difficult to attain, abide comfortably without fear, and be comfortable and happy, which causes them to ascend to nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 彼覺、觀已息，內靖、一心，無覺、無觀，定生喜、樂，得第二禪成就遊。
translation: Once perception and contemplation have stopped, he becomes internally calm and unified in mind, has no perception and no contemplation, and attains the accomplishment of the second dhyāna with joy and happiness arising from concentration.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 是謂彼於爾時得第二增上心，即於現法得安樂居，易不難得，樂住無怖，安隱快樂，令昇涅槃。
translation: This is called the second superior mental state that they attain at that point, which is to abide comfortably in the present life, which is easy and not difficult to attain, abide comfortably without fear, and be comfortable and happy, which causes them to ascend to nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 彼離於喜欲，捨無求遊，正念正智而身覺樂，謂聖所說，聖所捨、念、樂住、空，得第三禪成就遊。
translation: He parts with joy and desire, arrives at equanimity and pursues nothing, and with right mindfulness and right knowledge he personally experiences the happiness which is described by noble people as noble equanimity, mindfulness, happy abiding, and emptiness, and he attains accomplishment of the third dhyāna.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 是謂彼於爾時得第三增上心，即於現法得安樂居，易不難得，樂住無怖，安隱快樂，令昇涅槃。
translation: This is called the third superior mental state attained at that point, which is to abide comfortably in the present life, which is easy and not difficult to attain, abide comfortably without fear, and be comfortable and happy, so that they may ascend to nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 彼樂滅、苦滅，喜、憂本已滅，不苦不樂、捨、念、清淨，得第四禪成就遊。
translation: With their pleasure ceasing, suffering ceasing, the basis of joy and sorrow having ceased, they are neither discomforted nor delighted, equanimous, mindful, and pure, and they attain accomplishment of the fourth dhyāna.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 是謂彼於爾時得第四增上心，即於現法得安樂居，易不難得，樂住無怖，安隱快樂，令昇涅槃。
translation: This is called the fourth superior mental state that they attain at that point, which is to abide comfortably in the present life, making it easy and not difficult to attain, abiding happily without fear, and being tranquil and happy, so that they may ascend to nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 「彼如是得定心清淨，無穢無煩，柔軟善住，得不動心，覺憶宿命智通作證，彼有行有相貌，憶本無量昔所經歷，謂一生、二生、百生、千生，成劫、敗劫、無量成敗劫。
translation: "Thus attaining a concentrated mind that's pure, undefiled and undisturbed, flexible and well-abiding, they attain an unmoving mind, perceive and recall past lives, know and realize that they have actions and appearances, and recall past experiences that are countless and without limit, namely, one life, two lives, a hundred lives, a thousand lives, and eons of formation, eons of failure, and countless eons of formation and failure.

source_sentence: 彼眾生名某，彼昔更歷，我曾生彼，如是姓、如是字、如是生、如是飲食、如是受苦樂、如是長壽、如是久住、如是壽訖，此死生彼，彼死生此，我生在此，如是姓、如是字、如是生、如是飲食、如是受苦樂、如是長壽、如是久住、如是壽訖。
translation: Those sentient beings are called somebodies, which in the past were born there, thus surnamed, thus lettered, thus born, thus fed, thus subject to pain and pleasure, thus long-lived, thus long-abiding, thus long-lived, here born, here born, thus surnamed, thus lettered, thus born, thus fed, thus subject to pain and pleasure, thus long-lived, thus long-abiding, thus long-lived, thus long-lived.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 是謂彼於爾時得此第一明達，以本無放逸，樂住遠離，修行精勤，謂無智滅而智生，闇壞而明成，無明滅而明生，謂憶宿命智作證明達。
translation: This is called the first insight they attain at that point in time because they are originally free of carelessness, happily abide in seclusion, and cultivate diligence, which is the knowledge that arises when the lack of cognition ceases, the insight that arises when darkness decays, and the knowledge that arises when ignorance ceases, which is the knowledge that recollects past lives and works to realize it.

source_sentence: 「彼如是得定心清淨，無穢無煩，柔軟善住，得不動心，學於生死智通作證。
translation: "Thus attaining a concentrated mind that's pure, undefiled and undisturbed, and abiding softly and well, they attain an unmoving mind and train in the knowledge and realization of birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 彼以清淨天眼出過於人，見此眾生死時生時，好色惡色，妙與不妙，往來善處及不善處，隨此眾生之所作業，見其如真。
translation: With the pure divine eye that transcends that of humans, they see these sentient beings when they're born at the time of death, whether they have good or bad form, marvelous or marvelous, and whether they've been to good or bad places in the past, and they follow the actions of these sentient beings and see them as they really are.

source_sentence: 若此眾生成就身惡行，口、意惡行，誹謗聖人，邪見成就邪見業，彼因緣此，身壞命終，必至惡處，生地獄中。
translation: If this sentient being produces bad physical actions, bad verbal and mental actions, denigrates sages, and accomplishes the karma of wrong views, then as a result of these causes and conditions, his body will break up and his life will end, and he'll surely go to a bad place or be born in hell.

source_sentence: 若此眾生成就身妙行，口、意妙行，不誹謗聖人，正見成就正見業，彼因緣此，身壞命終，必昇善處，上生天中。
translation: If this sentient being produces marvelous physical conduct, speaks and thinks marvelously, doesn't denigrate sages, and right views accomplish right view karma, then as a result of those causes and conditions, he'll surely ascend to a good place and be born up in the heavens when his body breaks up and his life ends.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 是謂彼於爾時得第二明達，以本無放逸，樂住遠離，修行精勤，無智滅而智生，闇壞而明成，無明滅而明生，謂生死智作證明達。
translation: This is called the second insight attained by someone who, because they were originally free of carelessness, happily abide in seclusion, and cultivate diligence, has knowledge produced when the lack of knowledge ceases, has knowledge formed when darkness decays, and has knowledge produced when ignorance ceases, which is called the knowledge of birth-and-death that's realized.

source_sentence: 「彼如是得定心清淨，無穢無煩，柔軟善住，得不動心，學漏盡智通作證。
translation: "Thus attaining a concentrated mind that's pure, undefiled and undisturbed, flexible and well-abiding, they attain an unmoving mind and realize the knowledge and penetration of training that ends the contaminants.

source_sentence: 彼知此苦如真，知此苦習、知此苦滅、知此苦滅道如真，知此漏如真，知此漏習、知此漏滅、知此漏滅道如真。
translation: They know suffering as it truly is, know the formation of suffering, know the cessation of suffering, and know the path to the cessation of suffering as it truly is, know the contaminants as it truly is, and know the formation of contaminants, know the cessation of contaminants, and know the path to the cessation of contaminants as it truly is.

source_sentence: 彼如是知、如是見，欲漏心解脫，有漏、無明漏心解脫，解脫已便知解脫，生已盡，梵行已立，所作已辦，不更受有，知如真。
translation: Knowing and seeing thus, their mind is liberated from the contaminants of desire, liberated from the contaminants of existence and ignorance, and after being liberated, they then know that they are liberated, that their births have ended, that the religious practice has been established, that the task has been accomplished, that they're no longer subject to existence, and that they know it as it truly is.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 是謂彼於爾時得第三明達，以本無放逸，樂住遠離，修行精勤，無智滅而智生，暗壞而明成，無明滅而明生，謂漏盡智作證明達。」
translation: This is called the third attainment of insight at that point in time, because they are originally free of carelessness, happily abide in seclusion, and cultivate diligence; cognition arises when the lack of cognition ceases; light arises when darkness decays; and light arises when ignorance ceases, which is called the knowledge that ends contamination and produces proof of attainment."

source_sentence: 於是，尊者跋陀和利即從坐起，偏袒著衣，叉手向佛，白曰：「世尊！
translation: Venerable Bhaddāli then rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, saluted the Buddha with his palms together, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何因何緣，諸比丘等同犯於戒，或有苦治，或不苦治。」
translation: What causes and conditions do monks similarly violate the precepts, either with or without painful correction?"

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「跋陀和利！
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 或有比丘數數犯戒，因數數犯戒故，為諸梵行訶，所見聞從他疑者，彼為諸梵行訶，所見聞從他疑已，便說異異論外餘事，瞋恚憎嫉，發怒廣惡，觸嬈於眾，輕慢於眾，作如是說：『我今當作令眾歡喜而可意，作如是意。』
translation: If a monk repeatedly violates the precepts and, as a result of repeatedly violating the precepts, he is a critic of the religious practices and doubts what he sees and hears from others, then he will discuss other things besides differing theories, become angry and resentful, become enraged and hostile, touch and hate the people, despise the people, and make this kind of statement, 'Now, I will make the people happy and agreeable to them, and I will do so.'

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 諸比丘便作是念：『然此賢者數數犯戒，因數數犯戒故，為諸梵行訶，所見聞從他疑者，彼為諸梵行訶，所見聞從他疑已，便說異異論外餘事，瞋恚憎嫉，發怒廣惡，觸嬈於眾，輕慢於眾，作如是說：「我今當作令眾歡喜而可意。」
translation: The monks then thought, 'Still, this good man has violated the precepts several times, and because he has violated the precepts several times, he's been viewed and heard by Brahmā and doubted by others. After he has viewed and heard by Brahmā and doubted by others, he then discusses other things besides dissimilarities, becomes angry and resentful, rages and becomes violent, touches the crowd, despises the crowd, and makes this statement, "Now, I will make the crowd happy and agreeable."

source_sentence: 見已作是語：「諸尊！
translation: After he saw this, he said, "Venerables!

source_sentence: 當觀令久住。」』
translation: You will observe it and make it last for a long time.'"

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 諸比丘如是觀令久住。
translation: "Monks thus observe it so that it will last a long time.

source_sentence: 「或有比丘數數犯戒，因數數犯戒故，為諸梵行訶，所見聞從他疑者，彼為諸梵行訶，所見聞從他疑已，不說異異論外餘事，不瞋恚憎嫉，發怒廣惡，不觸嬈眾，不輕慢眾，不如是說：『我今當作令眾歡喜而可意，不作如是意。』
translation: "Suppose there's a monk who repeatedly violates the precepts and, as a result of repeatedly violating the precepts, reprimands the religious practitioners for what they've seen and heard and follows others into doubt, then he reprimands the religious practitioners for what they've seen and heard and follows others into doubt, doesn't say anything other than dissenting opinions, doesn't become angry and resentful, becomes angry and hostile, doesn't touch the crowd, doesn't despise the crowd, and doesn't say, 'Now, I will make the crowd happy and agreeable, and I won't do so.'

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 諸比丘便作是念：『然此賢者數數犯戒，因數數犯戒故，為諸梵行訶，所見聞從他疑者，彼為諸梵行訶，所見聞從他疑已，不說異異論外餘事，不瞋恚憎嫉，發怒廣惡，不觸嬈眾，不輕慢眾，不如是說：「我今當作令眾歡喜而可意。」
translation: The monks then thought, 'Still, this good man has violated the precepts repeatedly and, because he has violated the precepts repeatedly, he's a Brahma-practicing rebel who doubts what he's seen and heard from others.

source_sentence: 見已而作是語：「諸尊！
translation: After he sees this, he says, "Venerables!

source_sentence: 當觀令早滅。」』
translation: You will observe it and cause it to cease early.'"

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 諸比丘如是觀令早滅；輕犯禁戒亦復如是。
translation: "Monks, thus observe and cause early extinction; likewise is the case with minor infractions of the precepts.

source_sentence: 「跋陀和利！
translation: "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 或有比丘有信、有愛、有靖，今此比丘有信、有愛、有靖。
translation: 'Perhaps there's a monk who has faith, love, and equanimity, and now this monk has faith, love, and equanimity.

source_sentence: 『若我等苦治於此賢者，今此賢者有信、有愛、有靖，因此必斷，我等寧可善共將護於此賢者。』
translation: 'If we were to treat this good man with suffering, and now this good man has faith, love, and equanimity, and therefore we're sure to stop it, we might better work together well to protect this good man.'

source_sentence: 諸比丘便善共將護。
translation: The monks then worked together well to protect him.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 譬若如人唯有一眼，彼諸親屬為憐念愍傷，求利及饒益，求安隱快樂，善共將護，莫令此人寒熱、飢渴、有病、有憂有病憂，莫塵、莫烟、莫塵烟。
translation: "It's like a person who has only one glance, whose relatives are kind and compassionate, seek profit and benefit, and seek peace and happiness, and guard them well together so that they don't cause that person to have cold and heat, hunger and thirst, illness, grief, and sickness, or dust, smoke, or dust and smoke.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 復恐此人失去一眼，是故親屬善將護之。
translation: They're also afraid that this person might lose their eyesight, so their relatives will guard them well.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 如是比丘少信、少愛、少有靖，諸比丘等便作是念：『今此比丘少信、少愛、少有靖，若我等苦治於此賢者，今此賢者少信、少愛、少有靖，因此必斷，我等寧可善共將護於此賢者。』
translation: When such a monk has little faith, little love, and little composure, the monks then think, 'Now that this monk has little faith, little love, and little composure, if we were to treat this good man with pain, now that this good man has little faith, little love, and little composure, and therefore will surely be stopped, we might better work together well to protect this good man.'

source_sentence: 是故諸比丘善共將護，猶如親屬護一眼人。」
translation: Therefore, the monks will guard him well together, just as a relative guards a person."

source_sentence: 於是，尊者跋陀和利即從坐起，偏袒著衣，叉手向佛，白曰：「世尊！
translation: Venerable Bhadrapāla then rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, saluted the Buddha with his palms together, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何因何緣，昔日少施設戒，多有比丘遵奉持者？
translation: What were the causes and conditions that led many monks in the past to observe the precepts for the youngest generosity?

source_sentence: 何因何緣，世尊今日多施設戒，少有比丘遵奉持者？」
translation: For what reason does the Bhagavān today confer many precepts but few monks observe and uphold them?"

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「跋陀和利！
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 若比丘眾不得利者，眾便無憙好法，若眾得利者，眾便生憙好法。
translation: If a congregation of monks doesn't get benefits, then the congregation won't have jealousy of the Dharma, and if the congregation gets benefits, then the congregation will become jealous of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 生喜好法已，世尊欲斷此憙好法故，便為弟子施設於戒。
translation: After they become fond of the Dharma, the Bhagavān wants to end this fondness, so he bestows precepts on his disciples.

source_sentence: 如是稱譽廣大，上尊王所識知，大有福、多學問。
translation: Thus, his reputation is vast, known by the most venerable king, and he's greatly blessed and knowledgeable.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 若眾不多聞者，眾便不生憙好法，若眾多聞者，眾便生憙好法。
translation: If the multitude doesn't hear much, the multitude won't become jealous of the Dharma, and if the multitude hears a lot, the multitude will become jealous of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 眾生憙好法已，世尊欲斷此憙好法故，便為弟子施設戒。
translation: After the jealousy-pleasing Dharma arises in the congregation, the Bhagavān then sets precepts for his disciples because he wants to end that jealousy-pleasing Dharma.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 不以斷現世漏故，為弟子施設戒，我以斷後世漏故，為弟子施設戒。
translation: I don't confer precepts on my disciples because I want to end the contaminants of the present life, but I confer precepts on my disciples because I want to end the contaminants of the latter life.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 是故我為弟子斷漏故施設戒，至受我教。
translation: I therefore define the precepts for my disciples in order to end their contaminants and bring them to the end of my teaching.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 我於昔時為諸比丘說清淨馬喻法，此中何所因，汝憶不耶？」
translation: What was the cause of my teaching the pure parable of the horse to the monks in the past, do you recall?"

source_sentence: 尊者跋陀和利白曰：「世尊！
translation: Venerable Bhaddāli said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此中有所因。
translation: "There's a cause here.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 世尊為諸比丘施設一坐食戒，諸比丘眾皆奉學戒及世尊境界諸微妙法，唯我說不堪任，從坐起去，以不學具戒及世尊境界諸微妙法故。
translation: The Bhagavān has established a precept for monks to sit for a meal, and while all of them are dedicated to studying the precepts and the subtle Dharma of the Bhagavān's realm, I'm the only one who says it's not up to me to get up from my seat and leave because I haven't studied the full set of precepts or the subtle Dharma of the Bhagavān's realm.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是謂此中有所因。」
translation: This is called having a cause here."

source_sentence: 世尊復告曰：「跋陀和利！
translation: The Bhagavān again told him, "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 此中不但因是，跋陀和利！
translation: Not only is this the cause, Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 若我為諸比丘當說清淨馬喻法者，汝必不一心，不善恭敬，不思念聽。
translation: "If I were to explain the pure parable for the monks, you wouldn't be unified in mind, well-respected, or mindful of listening.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 是謂此中更有因也。」
translation: This is called the further cause here."

source_sentence: 於是，尊者跋陀和利即從坐起，偏袒著衣，叉手向佛，白曰：「世尊！
translation: Venerable Bhadrapāla then rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, saluted the Buddha with his palms together, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今正是時。
translation: "Now is the right time.

source_sentence: 善逝！
translation: Good riddance!

source_sentence: 今正是時。
translation: Now is the right time.

source_sentence: 若世尊為諸比丘說清淨馬喻法者，諸比丘從世尊聞已，當善受持。」
translation: If the Bhagavān teaches monks the pure parable of the horse, the monks will accept it well after hearing it from the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「跋陀和利！
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 猶如知御馬者得清淨良馬，彼知御者先治其口，治其口已，則有不樂於動轉，或欲或不欲。
translation: "It's like the person who knows how to control a horse and obtains a good, pure horse; that person knows how to control a horse and first treats its mouth; after treating its mouth, then there's discontent with movement, either desire or lack of desire.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以未曾治故。
translation: It's because it hasn't been treated.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
translation: Bhaddāli!

source_sentence: 若清淨良馬從御者治，第一治得成就，彼御馬者，然復更治勒口絆脚、絆脚勒口而令驅行，用令上閾，堪任王乘無上行，無上息治諸支節，悉御令成，則有不樂於動轉，或欲或不欲。
translation: If a good, pure horse is trained by its handler and the first training is accomplished, then the handler of that horse will then train its mouth, trip its feet, trip its feet, train its mouth, and cause it to drive, use it to make it go up the threshold, become capable of the king's vehicle's unsurpassed actions, and control all the limbs of unsurpassed calming so that they're trained, then there are people who aren't happy with movement, and either want or don't want it.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以數數治故。
translation: It's because of repeated discipline.

source_sentence: 跋陀和利！
